message.body: Hey how's it going?
Not too bad. How are things going with you?
Alright, looking forward to some time off this weekend.
Do you work weekends?
Sorry, I was in the middle of responding to your last text and got sidetracked. I do not work weekends, but I will often do a lot of personal work.
How bout you?
I usually have Saturday off but I'll wrk Sunday nights. Have two jobs. Personal work like projects/writing? Or more like errands
Projects/writing kind of stuff. Are both your jobs FT, PT or a combo?
Full-time at a bar and PT elsewhere. It's a good combo but it can wear me out
Do you write fiction or what?
No, mostly music criticism/interviews, but I've tapered off from that a bit as I focus on working on music and video work.
Re: multiple jobs; I used to work 3 PT jobs and it got to be waaayy too much.
That's really cool - I wrote a lot of reviews for a site a few years ago. Any genre in particular?
Yeah, it definitely teaches you how to juggle priorities though
Totally. No specific genre, mostly edge toward the weirder side of things. Have you also given up on journalistic writing?
Just to warn, 3-4 I will not be able to respond.
No that's fine / I'll be going in to bartend tonight so I'll be texting intermittently
I pretty much stopped writing after graduating college - I've done a bit of travel writing but only for myself. What are a few bands you wrote criticismon recently?
The last album review I wrote was for a band called Lake, and although I really enjoy them, they're not very indicative of what I usually listen to.
But the last few bands I've interviewed were Man Man, O'Death and XBXRX, all more along my tast lines.
Cool, I saw Man Man a few halloweens ago at the starlight
Ah nice. Yeah, I think one of my friends went to that show. They put on a pretty great performance. What other music are you into?
I'm into hardcore punk, hip-hop and I can get down with some instrumental stuff like Do Make Say Think
Sorry for the lag or if this wakes you up after a late night. Also a big hip hop fan, mostly 90s and 90s influenced. Do you commonly go to shows, etc?
No sweat dude - didnt wake me up
Yeah, I try to go to shows when I'm not working, which recently isn't so often unfortunately
I hear that. I used to really enjoy going to shows, but as I get older, I'm finding I am less and less motivated to do so.
I prefer making it out to house shows over legit venues these days
Do you have a favorite place to see shows in philly?
Interesting. I haven't been around the house show scene for a hot min. What are the active houses these days? I enjoy JB's a lot, sometimes KFN.
Haven't been to many in the past 6 months, but wolf cycles over on lancaster ave has had shows upstairs, sriracha castle in north philly, golden tea house in w philly
Interesting. It's good to know that people are still keeping it afloat. I was much more active with house shows, etc., around 2005-2009.
Since then, tho, I haven't really been to any.
Oh yeah, it's definitely still afloat. Have you been to any shows upstairs at KFN?
I saw a listing for that at some point, but was confused; the only place I know that's upstairs there is the Green Room, but it'd be a pretty intimate show up there. Is that where people play?
The last three shows that I've been to at KFN have been upstairs. It definitely just feels like someone's house
Ok, yeah, there's like a small hallway with a few rooms, right?
